TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

CARDINAL . The applicant 's wife and son have been suffering from chronic renal failure ( a gradual and progressive loss of the ability of the kidneys to excrete waste , concentrate urine , and conserve electrolytes ) since DATE and DATE respectively . Consequently they need haemodialysis ( a medical procedure that uses a machine to filter waste products from the bloodstream and to restore the blood 's normal constituents ) . They are both disabled on account of their disease ( first degree disability , PERCENT unfit for work ) .

CARDINAL . While they live in GPE in GPE - Vodă county , they have to travel to PERSON to receive their haemodialysis treatment . Initially , their transportation costs were covered by the regional hospital . However , starting from DATE , the hospital no longer covered these expenses . In order to continue to benefit from financial help , the applicant 's wife and son had to apply to the regional council , which could include the relevant expenses in the regional budget . The hospital informed the regional council about the situation . It also requested a confirmation that the applicant 's wife and son actually lived in GPE . Such a confirmation from the competent ORG authority was provided on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the regional council discussed amendments to the regional budget in order to include additional expenses to cover transportation costs for CARDINAL persons requiring haemodialysis in the county . All those in need of such support were granted it , except for the applicant 's wife and son . The reason for the refusal was certain information about the fact that they lived in PERSON and not in GPE and therefore did not need transportation to obtain haemodialysis treatment . The decision regarding the applicant 's wife and son was postponed .
CARDINAL . On DATE the regional council did not include on its agenda the issue of financial aid to the applicant 's wife and son .

CARDINAL . On DATE the regional council met again , and a declaration from the applicant 's wife was distributed to all the councillors . The issue concerning financial aid to the applicant 's wife and son was put on the agenda . When it was examined , several councillors spoke against introducing the amendments . The county President GPE stated that he had only seen the applicant twice ( implying that the latter did not live in GPE ) and that he was against misappropriation of public funds . Some councillors spoke of the applicant 's wife and son living at specific addresses in PERSON and not needing financial support . Others mentioned the applicant 's complaints to various authorities , including courts , against PERSON , and the need to protect him from unwarranted attacks .

CARDINAL . Then the applicant took the floor . According to the minutes of the meeting , he stated : “ ... what is most insulting is that my son was indeed a student until DATE , when his health worsened and he had to abandon his studies . My wife asked for help in DATE , but that was refused . They told her that she was good to go cultivate the land . My boy is not [ in PERSON ] . I do not take back my words that PERSON is a fascist ... ” .
CARDINAL . According to the applicant , he did not insult anyone during the meeting and did not use the word fascist .
CARDINAL . After the applicant 's statement , he was invited to leave the room and he eventually did so .

CARDINAL . PERSON , the president of FAC , used to be the head of the regional police station in the same county . In DATE he initiated criminal proceedings against the applicant for failure to pay taxes , following which the applicant was convicted on DATE . At the meeting on CARDINAL DATE one councillor noted that the applicant had made CARDINAL complaints against ORG to various authorities , including courts .

CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON asked the regional police station to initiate proceedings against the applicant for insulting members of the regional council “ during a meeting on DATE ” . He lodged an identical request with the prosecutor 's office .

CARDINAL . The applicant unsuccessfully asked the police to discontinue the proceedings , in the absence of a proper written or audio record of the statements made during the meeting on DATE . According to the applicant , at the beginning of the meeting it was declared that an audio recording was being made . The applicant asked for a copy of the audio record of the meeting , which was refused . He later initiated court proceedings in order to obtain that record , but the courts rejected his claims .

CARDINAL . On DATE a police officer charged the applicant with having insulted PERSON on DATE . The case file was sent to the local court , together with the TIME of the meeting on DATE and statements by CARDINAL witnesses . CARDINAL of the witnesses stated that the applicant had called PERSON a fascist for leaving his family without any help , while another said that the applicant had used a number of insulting words , without specifying which . The third ( PERSON ) explained that the applicant had not insulted anybody and even if some of his words could be considered vulgar , nobody was affected .

CARDINAL . Again on DATE the applicant was brought before the court . According to the applicant , he asked for witnesses to be heard in order to confirm that he had not insulted anyone . Without reacting to his request , and after a TIME hearing , the judge convicted and sentenced him to DATE detention . The court found that the applicant had called GPE a “ fascist ” and “ other insulting words ” . The applicant was immediately placed in detention and served DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed , referring to the absence of an audio record of the meeting and the statement by CARDINAL of the CARDINAL witnesses regarding the absence of any insulting meaning in his words during the meeting .

CARDINAL . ORG scheduled the hearing of the applicant 's appeal for DATE . On TIME he registered a request with that court 's registry to postpone the hearing due to the fact that he already had another hearing scheduled before ORG on DATE . The court held the hearing on DATE and did not refer to the applicant 's request . It rejected the applicant 's appeal as unfounded , finding that the lower court had properly examined the case and established that the applicant had insulted PERSON

CARDINAL . On DATE the newspaper ORG published an article describing the applicant 's case . In reaction to that article , on DATE PERSON and another regional councillor present at the meeting of DATE wrote to the applicant 's wife , explaining the reasons for the decision taken earlier rejecting help for her and her son due to the lack of information . They added that the applicant had not insulted anyone during that meeting .

CARDINAL . The applicant asked for the reopening of the proceedings in view of his absence from the hearing of DATE , but the request was refused on CARDINAL DATE . A further request to ORG office to initiate the reopening of the proceedings was also refused on DATE .

CARDINAL . NORP In parallel to the above events , on DATE PERSON asked the police to initiate criminal proceedings against the applicant for forging documents confirming his family 's residence in Palanca . The investigation was discontinued on DATE because the applicant and his family had their true residence in GPE . On DATE the prosecutor 's office initiated court proceedings aimed at deleting the applicant 's family 's registration as residents of ORG . On DATE the Prosecutor General 's office withdrew that court action .

CARDINAL . The applicant contends that he was detained for DATE , together with CARDINAL other persons , in a cell measuring QUANTITY . The cell was in the basement of the police station and was damp and dark , the window being covered by a metal sheet with holes in it . There was a wooden platform in the cell , QUANTITY wide , which was used as a bed by all CARDINAL detainees . No bed linen was provided and all the detainees had to sleep in their clothes . Heating was very limited and it was cold in the cell . All the other detainees smoked , exposing the applicant to passive smoking . Food was served CARDINAL times a day and CARDINAL of the meals were limited to a pot of tea and a slice of bread . There was no toilet or running water in the cell . Detainees were escorted to the toilet twice a day for TIME each , which was insufficient for their needs . They therefore had to urinate into plastic bottles in between their visits to the toilet , in plain view of the other detainees . There was no hot water and the applicant could not take a bath during his detention .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant 's wife and daughter wanted to visit him , but this was refused because of the short term of the applicant 's detention . His request to meet his family was also rejected because he was “ without exit ” , as noted also on the minutes of the personal search to which he was subjected upon being placed in detention .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant asked permission to visit a church in order to attend religious services after his mother 's death on DATE . This request was refused since he had not yet served DATE of detention . The applicant did not leave the cell during DATE , except for the short visits to the toilet . Since his glasses were taken away upon placement in the detention cell , he could not read newspapers and there was no radio or TV in the cell .

CARDINAL . In its report concerning its visit to GPE on DATE the ORG found , inter alia , the following ( unofficial translation from original LANGUAGE ) :
“ CARDINAL . Conditions of detention
b. cells at local police stations

CARDINAL . The cells seen by the delegation at the local police stations visited were not suitable for holding persons for TIME . They were dark , unventilated , unheated , dilapidated and dirty , and were equipped at best with a bench . In addition to cells , local police stations had a barred enclosure , referred to as a “ waiting room ” , which usually measured CARDINAL sq.m and was devoid of any equipment .

According to police staff , the cells were being used for periods of detention not exceeding TIME . However , the delegation received many allegations – and found documentary evidence in the custody records – that persons had in fact frequently been held TIME , on occasion for DATE .... Further , it became apparent that administrative detainees had spent DATE in cells at local police stations . The persons concerned had not been provided with mattresses or blankets , and had not been offered anything to eat ( the only food available was that brought by detainees ' families ) .

The current situation is totally unacceptable . The ORG calls upon the NORP authorities to take effective steps to ensure that nobody is kept TIME at local police stations . ORG steps should also be taken to equip all cells and “ waiting rooms ” with a means of rest ( e.g. a bench ) . Furthermore , all persons detained in local police stations , irrespective of their legal status , should be offered food at normal mealtimes . ”
